review.comment_positive: Very attractive hotel, with artistic decor, with a laidback tropical vibe.  Really liked the waterfall of plants draping the front of the hotel from top floor to bottom floor.  Breakfast was good and Vietnamese dishes were rotated daily for variety. review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe NhiÌ€n ra ThaÌ€nh phÃ´Ì
review.comment_positive: A really beautiful hotel, with a lovely rooftop bar area. All staff were lovely and very friendly, especially â€˜Namâ€™ who was so helpful to me and as my Vietnamese was non existent his English is amazing and I had many good conversations with him. My room was lovely, classy, roomy, comfortable and with very welcome air conditioning + a well stocked/refilled mini bar. There was one problem with my room, please see below. I should also mention the amazing Vegetarian restaurant next door.
review.comment_negative: Unfortunately I had to complain when I arrived as I did not have the room I ordered when booking with booking.com. Although it was on the 4th floor as I ordered it didnâ€™t have the balcony and city view I ordered, in fact it was a windowless room (apart from a shower window). Iâ€™m a photographer and had imagined all the photos I would take from my balcony high above the town. The young man on reception claimed this apparently happened all the time with booking.com and that this was the room I had ordered. I was tired from travelling and at the time accepted this as couldnâ€™t find any of my documentation to prove otherwise. However once I returned home I found my confirmation of booking email confirming that I had actually booked 4th floor with balcony and city view. Although the room I had was fantastic & the hotel too, my stay would have been even better if I had had the balcony I ordered, for my photography and for spending lazy mornings reading with a coffee. This needs to be sorted, is it a booking.com problem as suggested by the hotel and there are no rooms with balconies or was it the hotels fault, not fully honouring my booking? I feel bad criticising the hotel as otherwise they were excellent but feel I should be entitled to some compensation as I remember when booking that there were cheaper room options but I paid a bit more for the balcony.

Things have changed in Con Dao in the last 5 years and it is now not a really cheap place to visit. It is still reasonable and this hotel is good value for money. There are many seafood restaurants within walking distance. We can recommend the small family restaurant on the corner 30 metres from Mystery. GREAT home made noodles and reasonable prices. The only drawback is the ten minute walk to the beach and that's why it gets a 9.5 and not a 10. Thank you Mystery and your wonderful staff, we hope to be back in December.

review.room_type: Suite Deluxe vá»›i Bá»“n táº¯m Spa
review.comment_positive: Room was lovely and as advertised. The rooftop pool is more of a plunge pool, nice to chill out and enjoy the views. Breakfast was all right nothing special.
review.comment_negative:
Night staff were difficult on check out. We checked out at 5:20am as we had an early flight to catch. We had arranged airport transport with the day staff the night before which worked out well. After checking our room (which we found to be unusual given that it's not a budget hotel) the staff member pulled out a piece of blank paper and wrote down a charge of 100,000 dong with no explanation as to what for. When we questioned him about this he tried using Google translate to explain as his English was non existent. Google kept mistranslating and eventually he managed to tell us it was a charge for using the sauna, which neither of us used. Obviously he couldn't understand what we were saying when we tried to explain we did not use the sauna only the roof top pool. The issue was dropped 5 minutes later and we were brought outside to get a taxi. 

Just to note also we received a proper invoice when we checked in and paid for our room. This charge was not printed on an invoice, leading us to believe he was trying to scam us on check out. This may not be the case and it might be a genuine mistake on the part of the hotel but it certainly left a bitter taste in our mouths. 

We also feel we might have been overcharged for the taxi to the airport. 

We stayed in other accomodations on con dao and customer service was much better else where.

review.comment_negative: Despite the place and staff being great, the noise ended up ruining our 2 nights there. The room we had was not sound proof and the neighbors (house next to the hotel) were extremely noisy (loud discussions until 3am, karaoke, etc...). Even with all windows closed, it felt like they were right in the room with us. What was supposed to be a relaxing holiday didn't turn out the way we wanted to.

review.rating: Nice but expected more for price and marketing of hotel
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King
review.comment_positive: Comfort and cleanliness cannot be faulted. Decor is gorgeous. I think I had the smallest cheapest kind of double and it was ample room for a couple.
review.comment_negative:
Very few staff. I did visit during Tet so I HOPE that's why. As soon as one staff member is occupied you are just left waiting often with no acknowledgement. We had to wait near 10mins on arriving to be greeted - I was literally shouting down through a door marked "staff" to zero response.  

Renting a bike situation is annoying. Great it is so readily available but pricey if you aren't sure what your plans are and you don't want to book out a full block of days but maybe see what each day brings. You might have to get a different bike each day and pay for new petrol on top of the daily rental cost per day. Simply money grabbing. Better system required.

Then just little things that you'd hope would be available in a hotel of this calibre/cost: a toilet in/near the lobby and breakfast area, an iron and iron board available for guests to borrow and use, turning off the beach club vibe music on the rooftop (the rooftop isn't big enough to warrant that level), better equipped bar - I had messaged before booking to check they served both wine and beer, which I was assured they did but on asking for wine the member of staff said no and then panicked and literally found a bottle of wine before attempting to charge me 200k a glass.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Superior CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King
review.comment_positive:
1. Location is right next to the center. Close to most of tourist attractions.
2. Reasonable motorbike rental fee.
3. Early C/I.
4. Fast WiFi connection.
5. Comfortable bed.
6. Sustainability program & protecting the environment program.
7. Reasonable food & beverages prices.
8. Staffs tried their best to please every guests.
9. Smart TV. Can play Youtube, Netflix and Spotify.
10. Good aroma.
review.comment_negative:
1. No Booking.com Genius Member recognition.
2. No recognition for special occasion. No extra mile thoughtful counts for guests.
3. Cannot borrow iron and iron board. Only accept Laundry Services at extra cost.
4. No soundproof. Can hear noise from other rooms.
5. Room view not nice. (Stay in 3rd floor). You can see other guests from their rooms through their room's window.
6. Swimming pool tiles uneven. Diving is not advisable. Color of tiles match with the color of water. There's safety and security issue.
7. Guests should not be allowed to smoke at the pool and even at the pool side.
8. Should not use glass at the swimming pool. Safety and security purposes.
9. Night staffs should still wear decent uniforms while on duty.
10. More food varieties for breakfast. Consider to add some more local dishes or specialty dishes in Con Dao.
